cheatsheet.title: Nexus File Navigator in Package Explorer

intro.description: This cheat sheet describes how to use the Nexus file navigation feature of the package explorer.

item.title: Open the folder containing the .nxs/.hdf5/.h5 files
item.description: Once the Data Project is loaded, open the folder containing the Nexus files within the Project Explorer.

item.title: Browsing the data through the Nexus Data Editor and the Package Explorer
item.description:
All Nexus/HDF5 files appearing in the project explorer can be opened as folders and once opened will display the list of their content.
Furthermore, by default, all resource files in the Project Explorer have decorators displaying the size, date of creation and title/scan command if present.

item.title: Activate / deactivate the scan command and/or Nexus element decorator
item.description:
The scan command and Nexus sub element decorator (active by default) can be activated/deactivated through 'Window -> Preferences -> General -> Appearance -> Label Decorations' or through the link below.
The label decorator that manages the scan command decoration is called 'Nexus Scan Command and Title Decorator' for Nexus/HDF5 files and 'HF5 Tree Elements Decorator' for the sub element of these files.

item.title: Open the Nexus file in Nexus Data Editor
item.description:
In order to be able to display the Nexus file data in the DExplore plotting, we need to open the Nexus file with the Nexus Data Editor.
This can be done with 'Right Click on the Nexus file -> Open With -> Nexus Data Editor'.
Note: the Nexus files can also be opened by double clicking on one of the Nexus file sub element, however the editor used to open the file will be the last one in the workspace history used to open the file.

item.title: Navigate through the Nexus file data and have the plotting refreshed accordingly
item.description:
With the Nexus file opened in a Nexus Data Editor, select one of the Nexus file sub element in the Package Explorer.
Check that the plotting is updated accordingly.
Note: The HDF5 Editor will not be updated (no selection change) when a Nexus file sub-element is selected in the Package Explorer. Unlike for the DAT files discussed previously where the update works for both the editor and the plotting.
